title: Are there any good books out there on 'How to stop being a narcissist?' - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t “Stop being autistic” You don’t “Stop being an amputee” You don’t “Stop being a criminal” You most certainly do not “Stop being a bipolar” So why oh why would it occur to you that a personality disorder or condition such as bipolar disorder or autism could be any different from Narcissistic Personality Disorder? You don’t “Stop being the ultimate form of evil,” and this has always been the case. If you could stop being a narcissist, it means you never had the condition in the first place, and weren’t a narcissist. Narcissism is not proof of the condition, everybody has it. You don’t think you’re an angel, the perfect good…? But Narcissists surely use this on a higher degree than anybody. Again. You don’t quit autism, and the idea something implemented in a person’s identity could be simply dismissed is ludicrous. That idea is why people become sheep for the narcissist. Brainwashed fools unable to escape manipulation. You’re carrying baggage unknowingly.

It’s a DISORDER. You can’t stop being who they are. The game is what it is, and even though it has social advantages, and even though there are quora users who are gaining popularity here, we can’t change them. In fact, if you ever give that person a book, the tables will turn and calls you crazier than they are. They want to be far more superior on basically everything. But yep, to answer your question, I’m going to give a book. Not for them, but for you. Coping with Infuriating, Mean, Critical People: The Destructive Narcissistic Pattern

Probably—but when you consider that most professionals say we are all narcissists to a degree—the books are probably written by one. You can't get away from them: WE ARE THEM. It's all just a matter of degree. The other problem involves the central premise of your question: narcissism essentially can't be stopped. Hypothetically, NPD or narcissistic personality disorder, appears to be an unconscious process, and is considered, in fact, a delusional disorder.
